pros: Flexibility, Employee Focused, Benefits, Hybrid

pros: CEUs, free supervision, wonderful clients and opportunities for free trainings.

job_title: Client Service Representative in Aurora, CO
pros: Had an amazing time doing work for the community. Crisis Services is the spine of Aurora Mental Health Center.
cons: Lack of organization and support. Inner politics prevent folks from being promoted. Questionable clinical staff. Untrustworthy HR - allowed staff to be harassed by toxic managers under their watch. Your integrity will be challenged.

pros: continuing to adapt to community needs . works towards better pay yearly.
cons: dependent on state payer source, so pay raises are hard to come by.

job_title: Substance Abuse Counselor in Aurora, CO
pros: Amazing colleague level employees with a genuine desire to help.
cons: Executive team that needs better resource allocation and sensitivity training.

pros: The company has always been flexible and the new CEO is really trying hard to change and make things better. However there are people in positions who do not deserve management nor has the education to do so.
cons: It's very sad to work at a place where you have over a decade of experience yet the pay is really not worth it. The job started out being pretty flexible as well as that was the reason why I stayed, however I am starting to rethink the other opportunities that I'm missing for my career field. There are people at this company that makes more money than a person that has the degree to work in the particular field, I feel it it's not fair nor is it professional to give someone a job that really does not fit the profile.

review_title: Ethical providers. Excellent leadership. Welcoming Enviornment
pros: An organization dedicated to helping the needy in every way
cons: i can't think of any

review_title: Started out as a wonderful company but went downhill
job_title: Mental Health Counselor in Aurora, CO
pros: Some flexibility, many good co-workers, benefits were decent
cons: The management was terrible and the pay even worse. It was impossible to support a family on this pay in Colorado.

job_title: Patient Care Coordinator in Aurora, CO
pros: Flexibility for work schedule, location
cons: The salaries are below standard, minimal raises

pros: Lot of nice staff to work with.
cons: Don't treat their employees right.

pros: AuMHC was started by community members and continues to be a community-focused agency.  While the basic mission is to provide mental health services, the agency is engaged in collaborative projects throughout Aurora that support prevention and bring mental health services to people in other settings including medical offices, housing sites, schools, childcare centers.  Management works hard to balance the budgetary constraints with the mission of the agency and to create a supportive work environment.  There is always room for creativity and AuMHC fosters new programs through staff ideas and a strong grant-writing team.
cons: Behavioral health organizations that serve a large portion of Medicaid clients are under the stress of major system change and constant efforts on the part of the State and Federal government to manage Medicaid costs.  This is often done at the expense of the providers.  Employees need to be aligned with the mission to serve.

review_title: Busy. $50,000 per year is just not enough pay for what we do.
job_title: Mental Health Therapist in Aurora, CO
pros: The clients can be interesting, helping people feels great. Somewhat flexible schedule. Great learning experiences. Licensed therapists are largely free to schedule clients as they choose,  and basically manage themselves.
cons:
Very little acknowledgement for our hard work. 
$50,000 a year salary for highly educated and experienced therapists is insulting, quite frankly. The company is always complaining about having insufficient finances/cash flow.

review_title: Company is changing for the better
pros:
Flexibility in some locations.
Pay is slightly better in some sites than at other mental health centers.
New CEO is trying hard to change the culture and perception from the inside out.
cons:
No training opportunities.
Despite the slightly better pay there are no other incentives for being here.
Budget is cited as the reason nothing gets done.
Managers do not seem to get training although they have frequent meetings.
Takes a lot of get fired (which may be a pro for some people).
Don't have to actually do your job to keep it.

pros: New CEO is very good at her job, committed to changing the culture of the company, and truly care about the staff. The company has a solid strategic plan, and the CEO is raising capital to invest back in the staff (bonuses, salary increases, performance review, etc.)
cons: The pay is lower compared to other healthcare companies, but the new CEO is trying to fix this. A lot of their buildings are in need of update and repair. The CEO is executing a property consolidation plan to raise money for some much needed repairs and modernization.

review_title: Amazing place to work with GREAT flexibility making a difference
pros: I've been with AuMHC for 5 years and I have to say it has been the  best 5 years of my life.  AuMHC offers a great health benefits package that helps pay for a specialty drug that would other wise cost $2,000.  When I had a death in my immediate family I was given bereavement for one week and thanks to AuMHC  I have a great quality of life.
cons: Not sure I have any cons, this really is a great place

pros: Coworkers were very dedicated and passionate about there work, it was a pleasure in the beginning to go to work because of the mission.
cons: Upper management does not communicate at all with working staff,  no transparency or care about employees.  Staff always wondering when the next person will be laid off.

job_title: Clinical Case Manager in Aurora, CO
pros: Management when I started the position
cons: Once the program changed managers a lot of reasons I took the position initially Changed. in flexibility, favoritism for clients & employees, feeling less then other employees, lack of supervision or guidance.

cons: Lack of support and understanding from higher management, lower salary pay than the other centers in the area, lack of diversity.
